Text: Four Mile Tree is the name of a plantation near Jamestown, Virginia that once encompassed two thousand acres (8 km²), it was situated on the south bank of the James River opposite Jamestown, four miles (6 km) further north.

Text: Four Mile Tree:  The plantation house constructed circa 1745 remains well-preserved in its original historical state.
